summary: "Oliver Twist" is a book by Charles Dickens about an orphan boy who grows up in a harsh workhouse. Oliver runs away to London, where he gets mixed up with a gang of young thieves led by a man named Fagin. As Oliver tries to survive on the streets, he uncovers secrets about his family. The story shows the tough lives of criminals and the bad treatment of orphans in 19th-century London. It's like a journey through a dark world, and it made people think about how bad things were for kids back then. The book has been turned into movies and even a popular musical.
title: Oliver Twist
